results.title: The Little world of Dietmar Fill
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The late Dietmar Fill has been accorded many honours for his remarkable natural science films and his micro-photography. This series draws together the best of his work, giving us an insight into his film-making techniques and letting us meet the man.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: The Vision
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
This video concentrates on the alpine flora and fauna but also discusses Dietmar’s vision of the natural world. It focuses in the corroboree frog and again, the photography is excellent. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: The Survivor
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
At Dampier on the north west coast of Western Australia, a tidal creek has been dammed off from the sea to produce salt from seawater. Dietmar Fill puts the salt-ponds under the microscope in this study of how life responds to this increasingly stressful saline environment. Included is a general description of the Pilbara area and its former inhabitants, the salt lagoons and its mining.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Estuary
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Features the plants (mangroves) and animals living in a tidal estuary at Port Stevens, Sydney. Discusses the habitat problems of tidal movement and salinity in fresh water. Narrated by Robin Williams.

results.title: Shore
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Where the sea meets the land we find a place of harsh extremes and constant change. Dietmar, Bibi and marine biologist Elizabeth Pope, explore the rich and varied life of the rocky seashore. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: Lake
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Dietmar focuses on a small freshwater lake near his home in the Blue Mountains west of Sydney. He explores the life of the lake and expresses his concern for the likely impact of pollution on its ecology. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: Coral reef
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
This video takes us to Herron Island, describes the wildlife and then concentrates on the smaller prcesses of reef builders. This program takes a while to get started. The coral photography is very good.

group_works.title: Waves and beaches
group_works.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International

results.title: Waves and beaches
results.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Geography today: a search for order”.
Examines the relationship between waves and beaches on Spurn head on the north shore of the Humber Estuary. Simulated demonstrations, using time-lapse photography, show the effects of waves and sand in a wave tank. Discusses sediment movement and the effect of different amounts of wave energy on beaches. Simple field experiments examine the factors effecting the size and shape of a beach. Suitable for senior students due to technical language and complex concepts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International

results.title: Aspects of Central Place
results.creator_credit: Eric Harrison, Julia Spark and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geography today: a search for order”.
This film uses the Cambridge area of the United Kingdom to discuss the applicability of Christaller’s central place theory in a modern context. Explains the forces that have given growth to the city of Cambridge and the functions of centres at different levels of the settlement hierarchy in Canmbridge. Suitable for Upper-Secondary students.
